Instruction: Combine salt, paprika, onion powder, thyme, white pepper, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder in a small bowl; set aside.

Rub the spice mixture inside and outside of each chicken, then insert one onion into the cavity of each chicken. Refrigerate the chickens overnight, or for at least 4 to 6 hours, either in resealable plastic bags or double wrapped with plastic wrap.
Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Include chickens in a roasting pan.

Roast the chickens in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the meat near the bone registers at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), approximately 5 hours. Allow the chickens to rest for 10 minutes before carving.
